intro: Solenostemon veyretiae, commonly known as the velvetleaf strobilanthes, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. It produces showy, two-lipped flowers in clusters, typically in shades of purple or pink. Solenostemon veyretiae is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display and compact growth habit.
